overview: Fascination is a 1922 American silent drama film directed by Robert Z. Leonard and starring his then wife Mae Murray. The film is based on an original story by Edmund Goulding, soon to be a prolific film director.  The story capitalizes on Murray's continuing forays into outlandish costume dramas.
tagline: The story of what happened to Dolores DeLisa, a girl who dared to display her beauty in the most dangerous resort in Madrid
title: Fascination
